meanings.definition: The act of effacing or making something less visible or prominent.
meanings.sent1: The effacements of the graffiti on the wall were done carefully.
meanings.sent2: The artist used effacements to blend the colors seamlessly.
meanings.sent3: The detective found the effacements of the fingerprints quite intriguing.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like an effacements, wiping away all worries from his mind.
meanings.sent5: The gentle rain acted as effacements, softening the harsh lines of the cityscape.

meanings.definition: The process of erasing or wiping out something.
meanings.sent1: Effacements of the pencil marks were visible on the paper.
meanings.sent2: The teacher used effacements to correct the mistakes in the document.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick involved the sudden effacements of the drawing.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to be an effacements, slowly erasing memories of the past.
meanings.sent5: The wind acted as an effacements, blowing away the footprints in the sand.

meanings.definition: The state of being effaced or erased.
meanings.sent1: The effacements of the old building showed its age.
meanings.sent2: The book had suffered effacements from years of use.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked about the accidental effacements of his memory.
meanings.sent4: Her forgiveness was like an effacements, wiping clean the slate of their relationship.
meanings.sent5: The snowfall created a beautiful effacements, covering the imperfections of the landscape.
